help.info: Test if a point is contained inside the union of convex sets.
help.descr: Check if the point x0 is contained in one of the sets in the union U. The result it the logical statement if x \in U and false otherwise. If the point is contained inside the union, index of the sets in which the point lie is returned. If the point does not lie in the union, the index of the region with the least distance to the point x is returned. All sets in the union must have the same dimension, otherwise the evaluation cannot be done.

input.name: U
input.descr: Union object that holds sets derived from the ConvexSet class.

input.name: x
input.descr: A point in the same dimension as all the sets in the union.

input.name: fastbreak
input.descr: Do a quick stop in the consecutive search when x is contained in the first set it founds.

output.name: isin
output.descr: True if x \in U and false otherwise.

output.name: inwhich
output.descr: The index set that indicates in which sets contained in the union the point x lies.

output.name: closest
output.descr: If the point is not contained inside the union, this output indicates the index of the set that is the closest to the point x.
